Opened pull request "Add SchematronGenerator to internals visible (#500)" (#503) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Change IsInVersion to InitialVersion" (#501) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This change exposes a property on OpenXmlElements that show the earliest version it is supported. This simplifies much of the testing of version support and moves it all in terms of initial versions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Correct constraint registry initialization" (#502) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
The generator had been doing bit field checking for the format versions,
but with a custom enum where Office2007==0. Thus, everything always
included Office2007, even those items that shouldn't. This change is
mirrored in the generator by using FileFormatVersions itself so that 0
is a None value rather than a specific version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Change IsInVersion to InitialVersion" (#501) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This change exposes a property on OpenXmlElements that show the earliest version it is supported. This simplifies much of the testing of version support and moves it all in terms of initial versions.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ChartUpdater: Support for Combo charts" (#224) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
We are interested in ChartUpdater working with Combo charts. The combo charts are those that mix series of different chart types. A combo chart can be done using Word as shown at the screenshot:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27296704/40357379-4cb39ce6-5dbc-11e8-9440-dc050b7c3ce6.png)

We have tested the current ChartUpdater component for replacing the values of this chart in a DOCX:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27296704/40357386-53e63dfc-5dbc-11e8-9e1e-475d3d3267a1.png)

This chart combines two series: one is a bar chart and the other a line chart, with only the dots and in the secondary axis.

We provide in this repository an application that tests this: 
https://github.com/VictorIranzo/UpdateComboChart 

The result obtained is not the expected one. It seems that the ChartUpdater has added the new values of the two series in the bar chart section and has kept the section of the line chart. We couldn’t open the output document using Word, but if we use another editor like LibreOffice we see the mentioned result:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27296704/40357400-5ca8e692-5dbc-11e8-9a7b-4bdb94b3e685.png)

As you see, there are 3 series. The ‘Percentage’ series contains the data of the old chart. If we remove the line series manually opening the ‘chart1.xml’ file of the document, we realize that the values provided for the new chart have been inserted in the bar chart section:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27296704/40357421-6c11038a-5dbc-11e8-924d-ce533c87e458.png)
 
As we said, we are interested in this feature. We would like to know if you have planned to implement this feature.
Thanks 

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unable to Import Module Open-xml-powertools" (#223) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
I want to use powershell modules so I´ve tried next instructions:

```
The short form of the installation instructions are:

1. Make sure you are running PowerShell 3.0 or later
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> $PSVersionTable.PSVersion

Major  Minor  Build  Revision
-----  -----  -----  --------
5      1      16299  431
2. If necessary, run PowerShell as administrator, Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted (or RemoteSigned)
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-ExecutionPolicy
Unrestricted
3. Clone Open-Xml-PowerTools to %HOMEDRIVE%/%HOMEUSER%/Documents/WindowsPowerShell/Modules/Open-Xml-PowerTools
C:\Users\dionisor\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules>git clone https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools.git
Cloning into 'Open-Xml-PowerTools'...
remote: Counting objects: 2884, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.
remote: Total 2884 (delta 26), reused 25 (delta 25), pack-reused 2857
Receiving objects: 100% (2884/2884), 22.11 MiB | 7.91 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (1773/1773), done.
Checking out files: 100% (1394/1394), done.

C:\Users\dionisor\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules>cd Open-Xml-PowerTools
C:\Users\amachado\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Open-Xml-PowerTools>git checkout -b master origin/master
Switched to a new branch 'master'
Branch 'master' set up to track remote branch 'master' from 'origin'.
4. Import the module in PowerShell: Import-Module Open-Xml-PowerTools
Not find files:
'C:\Users\dionisor\Documents\Open-Xml-Sdk\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\bin\debug\DocumentFormat.OpenXml.dll'
'C:\Users\dionisor\Documents\Open-Xml-Sdk\DocumentFormat.OpenXml\bin\debug\System.IO.Packaging.dll'

```
How can I use it?

Thanks
